articles.headline: Their Hair Fell Out. Should the F.D.A. Have the Power to Act?
articles.snippet: Giants of the industry are facing off against smaller players over a proposal to give the F.D.A. more authority to ensure the safety of beauty products.
articles.abstract: Giants of the industry are facing off against smaller players over a proposal to give the F.D.A. more authority to ensure the safety of beauty products.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When the Los Angeles hairstylist Chaz Dean pitched his almond mint and lavender-scented hair care products — endorsed by celebrities like Brooke Shields and Alyssa Milano — he sold millions. But his formula got an unexpected result: itching, rashes, even hair loss in large clumps, in both adults and children.
articles.byline: By Eric Lipton and Rachel Abrams

articles.headline: Upset by Brexit, Some British Jews Look to Germany
articles.snippet: A desire to retain the right to live and work on the Continent after Britain leaves the bloc has led some to explore what was once unthinkable.
articles.abstract: A desire to retain the right to live and work on the Continent after Britain leaves the bloc has led some to explore what was once unthinkable.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Until Britain voted to leave the European Union, Philip Levine never thought deeply about his Jewish heritage.

articles.headline: In the U.S., VW Owners Get Cash. In Europe, They Get Plastic Tubes.
articles.snippet: European owners of tainted Volkswagen diesels are being offered far less in restitution than American owners, but online legal start-ups are working to close the gap.
articles.abstract: European owners of tainted Volkswagen diesels are being offered far less in restitution than American owners, but online legal start-ups are working to close the gap.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — Volkswagen owners in the United States will receive about $20,000 per car as compensation for the company’s diesel deception. Volkswagen owners in Europe at most get a software update and a short length of plastic tubing.

articles.headline: Bill Shine Steps Out From Behind the Scenes to Lead Fox News
articles.snippet: Mr. Shine, a loyal right-hand man to Roger Ailes, was little known outside the TV industry before Mr. Ailes’s abrupt departure and his promotion.
articles.abstract: Mr. Shine, a loyal right-hand man to Roger Ailes, was little known outside the TV industry before Mr. Ailes’s abrupt departure and his promotion.
articles.lead_paragraph: Bill Shine, the newly appointed co-president of Fox News, commutes two hours every morning from Long Island to Midtown Manhattan, leaving his house so early that, as he tells colleagues, “the other guys on the train all have Sheetrock on their boots.”

articles.headline: Pennsylvania’s Attorney General Is Convicted on All Counts
articles.snippet: The state’s top prosecutor was accused of leaking secret grand jury information in an effort to discredit a political rival, then lying to cover it up.
articles.abstract: The state’s top prosecutor was accused of leaking secret grand jury information in an effort to discredit a political rival, then lying to cover it up.
articles.lead_paragraph: NORRISTOWN, Pa. — She was a rising Democratic star. She was the first in her party to be elected state attorney general. She was one of the most powerful women in Pennsylvania.

articles.headline: An Olympic Event Where 1st Prize Is the Chance to Lose Billions
articles.snippet: Delegations from four cities are quietly competing in Rio, lobbying to host the 2024 Summer Games — a privilege that could cost them dearly.
articles.abstract: Delegations from four cities are quietly competing in Rio, lobbying to host the 2024 Summer Games — a privilege that could cost them dearly.
articles.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — Behind the scenes of the Olympic matchups and rivalries that draw large crowds here, there is stealth competition taking place in the hallways and hotels of this beach town worth tens of billions of dollars. It is a bidding war that could rival the most ferocious auction on Wall Street.

articles.headline: Early Voting Limits Donald Trump’s Time to Turn Campaign Around
articles.snippet: Trump advisers say there are nearly three months to counter Hillary Clinton’s vast operation and get Mr. Trump on message. But voting starts in less than six weeks.
articles.abstract: Trump advisers say there are nearly three months to counter Hillary Clinton’s vast operation and get Mr. Trump on message. But voting starts in less than six weeks.
articles.lead_paragraph: Advisers to Donald J. Trump keep reassuring Republicans that there is still plenty of time to rescue his candidacy — nearly three months to counter Hillary Clinton’s vast operation in swing states and get Mr. Trump on message.

articles.headline: Evictions by Armed Men Rattle a Mexican Tourist Paradise
articles.snippet: Aggressive property seizures, apparently legal but surrounded by questions, have shaken the beach town of Tulum and stained its image.
articles.abstract: Aggressive property seizures, apparently legal but surrounded by questions, have shaken the beach town of Tulum and stained its image.
articles.lead_paragraph: TULUM, Mexico — By the time Renaud Jacquet arrived at his compound of rental beach villas, invaders were crawling all over the place.

articles.headline: Russia Sends Bombers to Syria Using Base in Iran
articles.snippet: Russia became the first foreign military to operate from Iran’s soil since at least World War II.
articles.abstract: Russia became the first foreign military to operate from Iran’s soil since at least World War II.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — Russia launched a fleet of bombers bound for Syria on Tuesday from an Iranian air base, becoming the first foreign military to operate from Iran’s soil since at least World War II.
articles.byline: By Neil MacFarquhar and David E. Sanger
